alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:56AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Carroll County through 1030 AM CDT... At 956 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McKenzie, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McKenzie, Huntingdon, Bruceton, Atwood, Trezevant, Hollow Rock, McLemoresville, Westport, Hillard, Jarrell, New Zion, Hico, Hinkledale, Crews Store, Tate, Garretsburg, Palmer Shelter, Buena Vista and Wingo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
